tidbits.title: Rich Oil Reserves
tidbits.description: Equatorial Guinea is rich in oil reserves, contributing significantly to its economy and making it one of Africa's largest oil producers.

tidbits.title: Bioko's Biodiversity
tidbits.description: Bioko Island, part of Equatorial Guinea, is known for its rich biodiversity, including rare primate species like the drill and unique ecosystems.

tidbits.title: Colonial and Cultural Blend
tidbits.description: The country showcases a blend of colonial Spanish heritage and diverse indigenous cultures, reflected in music, dance, and traditional rituals.
